definition: horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]
lit. to kill the donkey when the grinding is done (idiom)/to get rid of sb once he has ceased to be useful
lit. a donkey's lips do not match a horse's mouth (idiom)/fig. beside the point/incongruous
pinyin: lu:2 chun2 bu4 dui4 ma3 zui3

definition: neither fish nor fowl/resembling nothing on earth
lit. the scholar buys a donkey (idiom); fig. long-winded verbiage that never gets to the point/idiom mocking scholastic pomposity
see 猴年馬月|猴年马月[hou2 nian2 ma3 yue4]
lit. to mistake good intentions for a donkey's liver and lungs (idiom)/fig. to mistake good intentions for ill intent
pinyin: hao3 xin1 dao4 zuo4 le5 lu:2 gan1 fei1

definition: (proverb) A lazy person will find many excuses to delay working/lit. When a lazy donkey is turning a grindstone, it takes a lot of time off for peeing and pooing
pinyin: lan3 lu:2 shang4 mo4 shi3 niao4 duo1

sentences.english: So the place site of fable "the ass of Qian "have nothing to Guizhou.
sentences.chinese: “黔之驴”寓言故事发生地点，完全与贵州无关。

sentences.english: And when the morning arose, they were sent away with their asses.
sentences.chinese: 清早天一发亮，就遣送这些人带着他们的驴走了。

sentences.english: Jest with an ass and he will flap you in the face with his tail.
sentences.chinese: 你跟驴子开玩笑，将被驴尾打耳光。

sentences.english: But, to his dismay, the donkey walks away.
sentences.chinese: 但是，使他惊愕的是，那头驴走开了。

sentences.english: The donkey helped them pull the field plow during sowing season and carry them to the market.
sentences.chinese: 这头驴平时帮他们种地拉磨，赶集时还要作脚力。

sentences.english: The kiln man was overjoyed, and sold it to him at once.
sentences.chinese: 窑工正是求之不得，立刻把驴卖给他。

sentences.english: They are looking for a fight in the Pacific and West Philippine Sea.
sentences.chinese: 他们在太平洋和西废驴病海寻求发动战争。

sentences.english: A city Laonongganzhao donkey, donkey Chuanghong Deng, fined 10 yuan.
sentences.chinese: 一老农赶著毛驴进城，驴闯红灯，罚10元。

sentences.english: What stops people from achieving their travel dreams
sentences.chinese: 是什么原因阻止了驴友们完成他们的梦想呢？

sentences.english: The ground under my donkey's feet was slippery with mud.
sentences.chinese: 驴脚下的泥，兀自滑滑的。

sentences.english: The ass felt quite proud. He lifted his voice_and_brayed, but then everyone knew him.
sentences.chinese: 驴感到很得意，他高声地嘶叫，却被人认了出来。

sentences.english: Others insisted wild burros shouldn't live in some of the western states.
sentences.chinese: 另一些人则坚持主张野生美洲驴不应生活在西部各州。

sentences.english: Ergothionine is found in the ampullary glands of horse and jack ass.
sentences.chinese: 在马和驴的腹腺中有麦硫因。

sentences.english: Have you ever wondered why they are unable to walk straight ahead?
sentences.chinese: 你想过为什么他们不能照直走向驴吗？

sentences.english: Speak, ye that ride on white asses, ye that sit in judgment, and walk by the way.
sentences.chinese: 骑白驴的，坐绣花毯子的，行路的，你们都当传扬。

definition: animals used for their physical strength (mules, oxen etc)/beast of burden
horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]
load carried by a pack animal
